project.teaser: In the future European mobility system, freight rail plays a key role in making a significant contribution to achieving the goals of the European Green Deal. The fastest and most efficient way to decarbonize freight transport is to shift freight to rail. To achieve this shift...
project.objective: In the future European mobility system, freight rail plays a key role in making a significant contribution to achieving the goals of the European Green Deal. The fastest and most efficient way to decarbonize freight transport is to shift freight to rail. To achieve this shift, the overall competitiveness of rail in the transport market should be improved. To strengthen the role of freight rail in the transportation market, it is necessary to attract the attention of freight customers. One manner to increase the awareness of rail freight is to provide customers with high-quality and open information about the possibilities of rail transport and the associated benefits of rail freight. The objective of the ESEP4Freight project is therefore to provide freight customers with an overview of the available rail freight services in Europe via a web platform. This will be supported by the creation of a Web Platform based on an existing map developed by SKGV that identifies freight flows with a higher potential for transport by rail. The Web Platform will include an Interactive map with different modules such as CO2 calculator, a schedule viewer, a contract toolbox and a match making tool. In addition, ESEP4Freight aims to support the shift of freight to rail by analysing the current contractual framework, proposing a set of recommendations for its updated and suggesting a set of harmonised and standardised models for transport agreements and contracts. The set of harmonised contracts will be also the base for piloting a new set of blockchain-based specifications for simplifying transport agreements and contracts.
project.title: European Shift Enabler Portal for Freight
project.keywords: web platform, interactive map, supply chain, intermodal shift, Key performance indicators (KPIs), emissions, environment, contractual and legal framework, smart contracts

article.title: New platform for available European rail freight services

result.title: D6.1 Project management and quality assurance plan
result.description: Instructions and templates for deliverables and reports. Criteria and rules for the project management procedures, roles, and responsibilities and quality planning, metrics, and control. It will also include a set of guidelines to guarantee the implementation of RRI in a proper manner, defining Open Science topics among others. (T6.1, T6.2, T6.3).

result.title: D1.1 Set of KPIs, assessment of emerging technologies and modal share analysis
result.description: This report will comprise the outputs of the T1.1, T1.2 and T1.3. The document will include 1) the sets of KPIs, 2) the description of the most promising innovations and an estimation of their effects on the modal share of rail in freight, and 3) the freight flows and types of goods with higher potential to shift to rail.

result.title: Knowledge hub: ESEP4Freight's contribution to rail freight information
D3.1 ESEP4Freight reference architecture
result.description: This report will include the outputs of T3.1 and will include the definition of the reference architecture describing the requirements, specifications and data models to build the web-based platform.

result.title: D1.2 Data collection
result.description: This deliverable will comprise the outputs of T1.4. This will include the datasets and will be accompanied by a document with the data collection plan.

result.title: D2.1 Specifications for the implementation of blockchain technologies and smart contracts in intermodal transport
result.description: This report will comprise the outputs of T2.2. It will include the specifications of 1) The informative layer, consisting of a set of specifications for the use of information exchange on event in the supply chain) and of 2) the contractual layer, consisting of a set of specifications for the intermodal trade clauses and milestones including recommendations on rights and duties amongst actors of the supply chain.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ESEP4Freight (European Shift Enabler Portal for Freight)
result.teaser: In the future European mobility system, freight rail plays a key role in making a significant contribution to achieving the goals of the European Green Deal. The fastest and most efficient way to decarbonize freight transport is to shift freight to rail. To achieve this shift...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D3.2 ESEP4Freight web-based platform
result.description: This deliverable will include the outputs of T3.2 and T3.3. It will comprise the final version of the platform, including the back-end modules, the data repository and the front-end.

result.title: D2.2 Analysis of the current legal and contractual framework and upgrade recommendations
result.description: This report will comprise the outputs from T2.1 and T2.3. It will include the analysis of the legal and contractual framework and a set of recommendations for adapting the current legislation towards a harmonized contractual framework. It will also include the set of model contracts to be included in the Web Platform.

result.title: D6.2 Data Management Plan
result.description: Data management plan and data quality related parameters, how data will be collected, stored, accessed, exchanged, as well as data approved for publication can be used by others (T6.3). The deliverable will be followed up by the end of the project by D6.3.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
category.description: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
